item.title: 20 Romantic Things To Do In Wine Country This Valentine's Day
item.description:
20 Romantic Things To Do In Wine Country This Valentine's Day

There will be plenty of love in the Wine Country air this Valentine's Day as couples celebrate not just the most romantic day of the year but a three-day weekend thanks to President's Day. We've rounded up 20 romantic things to do in Wine Country-10 in the Napa Valley and 10 in Sonoma County-so you can get started on your Feb.

item.title: Celebrate the 40th Anniversary of Napa Valley's Triumph over French Wines
item.description:
Celebrate the 40th Anniversary of Napa Valley's Triumph over French Wines

Auberge du Soleil is offering a five-course meal and special wine pairings in honor of the historic occasion...

item.title: Graphene 3D Lab and Ideum Team Up for an Interactive Wine Tasting Experience
item.description:
Graphene 3D Lab and Ideum Team Up for an Interactive Wine Tasting Experience

Jean-Charles Boisset, JCB Winesin Yountville, California has developed the JCB Wine Tasting Experience, which involves smart technology, 3D printed wine glasses, and some very sophisticated software. The experience takes place in the new JCB Tasting Salon, which features smart tables that seat four people each. Visitors are served five different wines over the course of the tasting, which lasts for 40 minutes to an hour.

item.title: Diageo completes US wine exit with Chalone sale
item.description:
Diageo completes US wine exit with Chalone sale

8th February, 2016 by Lauren Eads Foley Family Wines is acquiring the Chalone Estate Vineyard and Gavilan brands as well as nearly 1,000 acres of land, including 240 acres vineyards in the Chalone appellation in Monterey County, California.

item.title: A New Wave of Wine Lists
item.description:
A New Wave of Wine Lists

Hatchet Hall, a newish Los Angeles restaurant celebrated for its seasonal, Southern-inspired fare, may claim the top spot for its untraditional list of wine options devised by Wine Steward Maxwell Leer. Here, #bottleselections are not classified in any particular fashion, instead they're lumped into bunches dictated by the wine importer who gives them SKUs.

item.title: 'World's best chef', who committed suicide, was 'victim of £1m wine scam'
item.description:
'World's best chef', who committed suicide, was 'victim of £1m wine scam'

The same bottles, priced between £14,000 and £27,500, were allegedly sold three or four times to various unsuspecting buyers. According to Bilan, Violier's restaurant suffered losses due to the scam of between £554,700 and £1.37 million. * French chefs call on peers to stamp out culture of violence at top restaurants Private Finance Partners was declared bankrupt on November 30 last year.

item.title: Wine Spectator: Tapping The Potential Of Wine In Kegs - Shanken News Daily
item.description:
Wine Spectator: Tapping The Potential Of Wine In Kegs - Shanken News Daily

February 4, 2016 Three years ago, the wine-on-tap category hardly existed. Thanks to enthusiasm from wineries and growing interest from restaurants, more than 3,900 locations in 49 states now offer it, nearly double the number of locations of two years ago.

item.title: A Red Wine That Eliminates the Post-Drink Headache
item.description:
A Red Wine That Eliminates the Post-Drink Headache

Marketwatch's Charles Passy serves a one-of-a-kind "low histamine" red wine that is less likely to bother those affected by "red wine headache" syndrome. Photo: Getty

item.title: Cellar Collections
item.description:
Cellar Collections

Silver Oak 2011 Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon "Our 2011 Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon is an elegant representation of Napa Valley Cabernet from a cool vintage. It presents an opaque garnet hue in the glass and reveals aromas of sandalwood and roasted meats.
